question.title: Reverse Only Letters
question.content:
You are given a string, ‘S’. You need to reverse the string where characters that are not an alphabet stay in the same place, and the rest reverse their positions.

Eg: “a-bcd” becomes “d-cba”

Input Format:
The first line of the input contains ‘T’ denoting the number of test cases.

The first line of each test case contains a string ‘S’.
Output Format:
For every test case, we need to print the reversed string in a new line.
Note:
You do not need to print anything, it has already been taken care of. Just implement the given function.
Constraints:
1 <= T <= 10
0 <= |S| <= 5000

Where |S| denotes the length of string 'S'.

Time Limit: 1 Sec
Sample Input 1:
2
a-bcd
!s-cx
Sample Output 1:
d-cba
!x-cs
Explanation Of Sample Input 1:
In the first test case:
“a-bcd” after removing non-letter will be “abcd”.
Reversing “abcd” will get “dcba”.
Placing non-letters in the correct position in “dcba”, we get: “d-cba”.

In the second test case:
“!s-cx” after removing non-letter will be “scx”.
Reversing “scx” will get “xcs”.
Placing non-letters in the correct position in “xcs”, we get: “!x-cs”.
Sample Input 2:
2
a-bC-dEf-ghIj
Qedo1ct-eeLg=ntse-T!
Sample Output 2:
j-Ih-gfE-dCba
Test1ng-Leet=code-Q!
Explanation Of Sample Input 2:
In the first test case:
“a-bC-dEf-ghIj” after removing non-letter will be “abCdEfghlj”.
Reversing “abCdEfghlj” will get “jlhgfEdCba”.
Placing non-letters in the correct position in “jlhgfEdCba”, we get: “j-Ih-gfE-dCba”.

In the second test case:
“!s-cx” after removing non-letter will be “Qedo1ct-eeLg=ntse-T!”.
Reversing “QedocteeLgntseT” will get “TestngLeetcodeQ”.
Placing non-letters in the correct position in “TestngLeetcodeQ”, we get: “Test1ng-Leet=code-Q!”.

rephrased.body: Given a string 'S', reverse the string such that alphabet characters are reversed, while non-alphabet characters remain in their original positions.
constraints: Where |S| denotes the length of string 'S'.

testcases.explanation: The alphabets in "a-bcd" are 'a', 'b', 'c', and 'd'.  Reversing these gives 'd', 'c', 'b', and 'a'.  Placing the non-alphabet character '-' in its original position results in "d-cba".
The alphabets in "!s-cx" are 's', 'c', and 'x'. Reversing these gives 'x', 'c', and 's'. Placing the non-alphabet characters '!' and '-' in their original positions results in "!x-cs".

The alphabets in "a-bC-dEf-ghIj" are 'a', 'b', 'C', 'd', 'E', 'f', 'g', 'h', 'I', and 'j'. Reversing these gives 'j', 'I', 'h', 'g', 'f', 'E', 'd', 'C', 'b', and 'a'. Placing the non-alphabet characters '-' in their original positions results in "j-Ih-gfE-dCba".

The alphabets in "Qedo1ct-eeLg=ntse-T!" are 'Q', 'e', 'd', 'o', 'c', 't', 'e', 'e', 'L', 'g', 'n', 't', 's', 'e', and 'T'. Reversing these gives 'T', 'e', 's', 't', 'n', 'g', 'L', 'e', 'e', 't', 'c', 'o', 'd', 'e', and 'Q'. Placing the non-alphabet characters '1', '-', '=', and '!' in their original positions results in "Test1ng-Leet=code-Q!".

hints: Try to use variables to track the positions of last and first alphabets.
